data.title: Prince's Home and Studio
data.meta_site_name: Paisley Park | Prince's Home and Studio
data.text:
What is Paisley Park?

Paisley Park is an active museum, state-of-the-art recording studio and concert venue in Chanhassen, MN. For nearly 30 years, the facility served as Prince’s home, creative sanctuary and production complex.

Fulfilling Prince’s vision that Paisley Park would one day be open to the public, the venue today welcomes fans, musicians and audiophiles for tours, concerts, festivals and special events.

While Paisley Park is thought of as both a concept and as a physical venue, Prince’s core vision and articulation of Paisley Park thrives today as:

A Museum

A Recording Studio

A Live Music Venue

An Event Space

An Educational Organization

Where is Paisley Park?

Paisley Park is located at 7801 Audubon Road, Chanhassen, MN – about a 20-minute drive from the Minneapolis–Saint Paul International Airport. Or, in Prince’s words, “Ask where they’re going, they’ll tell U nowhere.”

When can I visit Paisley Park?

Museum tours are held all year long. Buy tickets and find more information here.

Why is Paisley Park in Minneapolis?

Minneapolis helped shape Prince into the man and the artist he became. In return, Prince always remained close to his roots and felt it was important to give back to his hometown, even as his success swept the globe. Prince put Minneapolis on the map with his music and his distinct style.

Artistically, building Paisley Park in Minneapolis allowed Prince to creatively flourish unaffected by the cultural inputs of typical big cities like Los Angeles or New York.

As Prince once said, “I like Hollywood. I just like Minneapolis a little bit better." – Prince

How can I get a job at Paisley Park?

Join our team! See what positions we have available here.

How will I know if Paisley Park is closed because of inclement weather?

In the event of inclement weather, closures will be announced on our Facebook page.

When was Paisley Park built?

Following the meteoric success of Purple Rain, Prince built Paisley Park the course of two years, with initial plans drawn in 1985, and the doors opened on September 11, 1987.

Why did Prince build Paisley Park?

Prince often referred to Paisley Park in songs and interviews, even before the building was constructed. The rich narrative that Prince built around Paisley Park positions it as much a concept and myth as it is physical space.

As a physical venue, Prince built Paisley Park to be an environment where he could create in a free, independent and open manner – realizing any artistic vision, whether it be a song, video, movie, photoshoot, visual art form or any other creative output all under one roof. Decades later, this concept of an all-encompassing, single-location creative haven would become popular, but Paisley Park was the first-of-its-kind in the musical world.

In concept, Paisley Park is an environment in which one can be truly “free” – uninhibited by history, social, cultural or economic factors; characteristics like ethnicity, race, wealth and education don’t matter at Paisley Park. In his 1985 song “Paisley Park,” Prince sings, “Admission is easy, just say U Believe, and come 2 this Place in your heart, Paisley Park is in your heart.”

Why did Prince build Paisley Park in Minneapolis?

Minneapolis helped shape Prince into the man and the artist he became. In return, Prince always remained close to his roots and felt it was important to give back to his hometown, even as his success swept the globe. Prince put Minneapolis on the map with his music and his distinct style.

Artistically, building Paisley Park in Minneapolis allowed Prince to creatively flourish unaffected by the cultural inputs of typical big cities like Los Angeles or New York.

As Prince once said, “I like Hollywood. I just like Minneapolis a little bit better." – Prince

How big is Paisley Park?

Paisley Park is a 65,000-square-foot complex and sits on roughly nine acres of land.

How long did it take to build Paisley Park?

It all begins with an idea. Maybe you want to launch a business. Maybe you want to turn a hobby into something more. Or maybe you have a creative project to share with the world. Whatever it is, the way you tell your story online can make all the difference.

How do I buy tickets to Paisley Park?

“Admission is easy, just say U B-lieve.” Tickets are available for purchase online 24/7. Tickets go fast and space is limited. To guarantee admission please purchase online in advance.

Can I get tickets to raffle off at my charitable event?

To continue Prince’s philanthropic efforts, Paisley Park has a limited number of tickets reserved, upon request, to qualifying organizations to be used for fund raising and outreach purposes each year. Priority is given to organizations whose philosophy aligns with organizations that Prince supported in the past. For more information and ticket requests, please email info@paisleypark.com.

Does Paisley Park offer tours to charitable organizations?

Yes, there are limited opportunities for philanthropic organizations to receive a tour to provide for a group who would be otherwise unable to attend. These tours will be planned not to disrupt the existing tour schedule and will only be given out upon request. This type of tour offering is not guaranteed, but if you feel that your group aligns with a cause that Prince supported in the past, email info@paisleypark.com for more information.
